newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - April 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - April 5.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Korean President Kim Young Sam has honoured Bangladesh's Foreign Minister Abdus Samad Azad with "Gwanghwa" (Order of diplomatic service merit) for his meritorious service to the Bangladesh's diplomacy.
A national human rights commission is expected to be formed in Bangladesh, Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister Abdul Matin Khasru said.
A two-member Indian delegation arrived in Dhaka on Saturday for follow-up talks with Bangladesh officials on the recently concluded treaty on sharing of the Ganges water.
Austrian Deputy Minister for Economic Affairs, Josef Mayor, arrived in Dhaka on Thursday on a two-day visit to explore business opportunities with Bangladesh.
Am eight-member delegation of International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) Bangladesh will join the 32nd ICC World Congress to be held in Shanghai April 8-10.
Communications Minister Anwar Hossain has said the Jamuna Bridge, to be opened next year, would bring about a revolutionary change in the overall economy of Bangladesh.
The governemnt will make its best effort to reduce its borrowings from the banking system, Finance Minister S A M S Kibria said.
Country's debt burden may go up as the share of concessional loan in the external aid packages has started declining. REUTER
